TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpContextBase extends System.Object implements class System.IServiceProvider
Public MustInherit Class HttpContextBase Implements IServiceProvider
public ref class HttpContextBase abstract : IServiceProvider

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that contain HTTP-specific information about an individual HTTP request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class to call members on the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> object.

protected: HttpContextBase();

Docs.param: The object that should process the request.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, specifies a handler for the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you set `handler` to `null`, the default handler is used to process the request. You can set `handler` to either an asynchronous handler or to an synchronous handler. The handler must implement the <xref:System.Web.IHttpHandler> interface.

Docs.exception: A derived type fails to implement this method.
